name: highbrow
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of books, plays, etc.) involving serious and complicated or artistic ideas, or (of people) interested in serious and complicated subjects Compare
lowbrow mainly disapproving
middlebrow adjective mainly disapproving

a person who is only interested in serious art or complicated subjects: This is a film for highbrows.
More examplesFewer examplesLiterary highbrows may mock the genre, but romance or "women's fiction" is big business.She is a scholar and a bit of a highbrow.Only highbrows read books like this.The highbrow among us might argue that there's no comparison between an Ibsen play and a soap opera.

Add to word list
(of literature, art, music, films, or plays) serious and intended for intelligent educated people who know a lot about these forms of art, or (of people) intelligent and knowing a lot about such things: highbrow entertainment a highbrow intellectual
